I realize something unexpected.
It only has 4 GB of RAM

So all the version I have seen in online stores

they offered both 4 jijabyte and 8 jijabyte

Eventually, they retired the 4 Gingerbread

So... what I got here is a bit of an artefact
of the first models of this product. If you

go and buy one new you are likely to get something
significantly better.

At least it is dual channel and somewhat fast,
but the RAM limitation actually sorts of kills

my most ambitious plans for this device. However,
it does represent an interesting challenge.

Every day I received many comments of people
specifically asking about what they could
do about lack of RAM.

Thankfully, RAM is the one thing that many
laptops can upgrade but if you are stuck with

a device like the GPD Pocket with no upgrade
options. What can you do?
Part 1: The Operating System

So the first thing to consider is Windows
itself. As Windows 10 changes with time and

gains more and more functionality the basic
amount of ram it uses keeps rising. With absolutely

nothing else running in the background the
task manager was showing more than 40% of
the memory already used.

Older versions of Windows tend to use less
RAM, but many parts of the GPD Pocket are

straight up not compatible with it and unlike
Linux, you can´t really customize it for
super light usage... or can you?

Deep in the bowels of the web, there are "lite"
versions of Windows 10. These are unofficial

hacks that have removed every single optional
functionality of the system. It can not do

"search", it includes almost no software,
there are random elements that will not work

but in exchange, its installation takes less
hard drive space and significantly less RAM.

This is not to be confused with the yet unreleased
official Windows 10 lite that will only allow

programs from the Microsoft Store. The unofficial
one is simply regular Windows 10 without bloatware
and optional services

Now, a disclaimer: I won´t be providing links
to this "Windows 10 lite" for very obvious
reasons.

You can sort of use this as an official Windows,
as you can activate a Windows 10 lite install

using a genuine windows 10 key, like the one
usually included with a GPD Pocket 2.

And I am going to try it for experimental
purposes even though I can not endorse using

this in the long run, especially if you are
putting any personal information or passwords on
this thing.

If you use an encrypted password storage like
Dashlane, the one I use and this video Sponsor,

you don´t have to worry much about your encrypted
password storage being uploaded somewhere

and I do recommend using a secure password
manager like Dashlane in any case, although

However you do have to worry about keyloggers getting
your master password. So... be conscious when

you use OSes taken from some weird corner
of the internet and always check your sources

Surprisingly the installation from the USB
drive took less than 15 minutes

and after installing the drivers from the
GPD website

and the latest intel HD driver the laptop
was fully usable. It was the quickest Windows
install I have ever done

and the result is beautiful with only close
to 22% RAM usage. This might be a very interesting
discovery for low end PCs.

Add to that removing all startup programs
and all non-windows services from the start,

except anti-cheat systems for games and steam
and we might actually have a solid chance
at this thing.
Part 2: Games

The majority of the adjustments you can usually
do on a game´s configuration file can lower

the GPU load, and sometimes the CPU load but
rarely if every lower RAM usage.

Furthermore, this is running an integrated
GPU which means it is also using the ram as

VRAM which puts further pressure on the limited
memory.

When the computer runs out of ram it starts
allocating hard drive space in what is called

memory paging, but since even an SDD is much
slower than RAM

this will case incessant stuttering on any
game that will make it unplayable at best
and at worst simply crash the game on launch.

You can use lower resolutions, lower textures
sizes and so on to reduce VRAM usage and therefore

RAM usage on integrated GPUs. This is not
universal and your result might vary but it

can occasionally help and you can reach some
interesting results as I am about to show.

Let´s start with Fortnite. 720p with a 50%
internal resolution and lowest settings. Exclusive
fullscreen

as described in my latest video on the topic,
using the internal FPS counter as to not use
any memory on external software

and closing the epic launcher as soon as the
game launches to save on that memory as well.

On its original release the game had 4 GB
of ram as its minimum requirement, but as

the game has evolved it tends to need just
a bit more.

Using all out tricks the game still suffers
some stuttering when the whole map is visible

but tends to do a bit better once you land.
I know this CPU and GPU can handle this game,

but the stuttering caused by low memory can
happen in the most inappropriate times. It

is a good start, but we can do better... and
better we will.

Here is Overwatch, another game with 4 GB
on the system requirements that has ballooned

a bit over that. This was a total stutter
fest on regular windows, but now it is doing

pretty nice with barely any stutter during
normal play. This is lowest settings, 720p
exclusive fullscreen with 50% internal resolution

and the trick I talked about my video so Battle.net
autocloses when the game starts for a bit
of extra ram.

The integrated GPU and is thermal limits provide
something between 30 and 60 fps, which can

drop a bit on the most intense moments but
surprisingly never stops being playable. With
a 30 fps cap I reckon this will do good.

I had a full match with no problems and it
was a great way to actually test if the small

keyboard was usable for gaming, and boy is
it better than the one on the first Pocket.

Let´s jump to some shooters on Steam. While
you can´t close Steam in the background to

save on ram without closing the game we can
at least use its fps counter and as you can

see CSGO on 960x540 does slightly better than
Overwatch, with not competitive but definitively

playable results. A bit less than I expected
but nonetheless good.

In the territory of single-player shooters,
we can try Bioshock Infinite.

This Unreal Engine 3 game can be heavily tweaked
on its configuration files to remove effects

and lower textures. The result is that on
960x540 the game is very playable, keeping

itself over 30 fps at the worst moments, and
often a bit more.

To close a little preview of a future project.
A lot of fans have been sending me tips of

lesser-known tweaks you can do on the original
tomb raider to screw around with the texture

quality and the texture filtering. While I
will eventually make this on its own separate

video using those changes and a resolution
of 960x540

the games benchmark shows an impressive 57
fps

and in actual gameplay, it keeps itself closer
to a cool 40. Again another game that could

do great with 30 fps lock, even without going
to these extremes and might make for a good
portable experience.

So, in conclusion. While the overall GPD Pocket
2 is an amazing improvement over the first one

if you are getting one make sure it is the
more common 8 GB model.

If you are limited to 4 there is still a fair
amount of gaming you can do with some effort.

I am on the process of borrowing an 8 Gingerbread
model for a second part video... at some point.

In the meantime, I am going to likely format

have more control over ram usage as it might
